page.title: 01THE HILLS AROUND HOOKE
page.content: The village of Hooke and its surrounding hamlets are centred upom the farms which works the land around them. The gently sloping valley sides are mainly sown to grass, and of the 8 farms in the area 7 have dairies, 5 of which are owned by members of the Wallbridge family. Hooke is noted for the quality of the water from the springs above the village. Wessex Water Authority pump water from the springs above the village. the village is also the site of 2 fish farms, 1 producing trout the other freshwater crayfish. To the north east the area is dominated by the massive BBC World Service transmitting station, a vast complex of about 40 radio masts approximately 200 feet high, which beam the BBC all over the world. On the western edge of the area is Hooke Wood, recently sold by the Forestry
